ranked_diseases.explanation: Usher syndrome is characterized by sensorineural hearing impairment and often involves retinitis pigmentosa. Type 1 is the most severe and begins early in life.
Pendred syndrome often includes sensorineural hearing loss and thyroid problems, which may develop in early adulthood.
Waardenburg syndrome can include sensorineural deafness along with pigmentary abnormalities. Type 1 is commonly associated with dystopia canthorum.
Alport syndrome can cause sensorineural hearing loss and kidney abnormalities. It is important to rule out kidney findings in the absence of clinical data.
This syndrome primarily involves profound congenital deafness and arrhythmic heart conditions, which might develop over time.
